documents.document: @DerekSnider Smokey Robinson is the cure for what ails us!
. It's all better now, right? Smokey and the Miracles have a way with such things.
Everyone's tense, consumed by politics. It's important, but it's Saturday night. Pour a glass, put on You Really Got A Hold on Me by Smokey.
@ThrivingDev personally, I choose a space mission over self driving cars. I've been in lots of cars, but I really want to go to space, man.
With two of the finest journalists I've ever worked with. @CdnPress @CdnPressStyle https://t.co/rw2SFZxVD0
@mlkibler @catherinebnn It's like we're barely worth worrying about (we hope).
. @allisonjones_cp GO train riders, myself included, may not have nuclear qualifications, but I've met more than one cab driver who does.
@crudereporter @rosskay I do what I can with the limited brains the good Lord gave me!
@rosskay Would seem a strange play, since it took them so long to red flag the market in the first place.
@CourtHeelsCP24 Yes, yes I am. And to declare you now the coolest person at CP24. Sorry, @cristina_CP24
Vancouver sales (homes changing hands) stats: Total sales down 39.5% YoY. Detached: -57.6%, Apartment: -24.7%, Attached: -32.4%. @BNN #VanRE
@greg_bonnell @BNN CORRECTION: 0.6% drop is month over month, not year over year. One year change is +15.8%.
@penultsquire @BNN I've always been skeptical of the benchmark, while it makes sense to smooth out distortions, who's doing the smoothing?
@penultsquire @BNN Benchmark or average.... the basis of the new Fight Club. Think Brad Pitt and Ed Norton would sign on for the sequel?
@InfinitusCap @BNN 20%-plus drop is classic definition of bear market in equities, but as with all thing real estate... people will argue..
Benchmark Vancouver detached sale prices falls to $1.47M in January, down 6.6% over the last six months, 0.6% over 1 year. #VanRE @bnn
Average Vancouver detached sale price falls to $1.5 million in January, down 17.5% from peak of early 2016. #VanRE #RealEstate @BNN
@Cmdr_Hadfield And a flying crab trying to eat them?
@hainsworthtv One must love themselves before they can love others... or some such.
2/2 .... indeed the marginal buyer, active in the high end of the market. @davio9999 @crudereporter
@davio9999 @crudereporter TREB argues that 66% of foreign purchases are homes under $1 million. Others will suggest they are ... 1/2
Trump is a “blunt instrument for us,” Bannon told Ken Stern for Vanity Fair last summer. “I don’t know whether he really gets it or not.”
@drewinning haha. Probably the several hundred other realtors I'm surrounded by in this baquet hall.
TREB sets sights on supply constraints as it lays out 2017 forecast, says role of foreign buyer is minimal & tax would be misguided. @BNN
Ipsos poll commissioned by TREB finds 40% of foreign buyers purchased home as primary residence, 25% to rent out. @bnn #RealEstate
Ipsos poll commissioned by TREB finds 4.9% of GTA home sales involved foreign buyers from Nov 2015 to Nov 2016. @bnn #RealEstate
Sat down with Canada's top diplomat today to talk diplomacy and trade with @realdonaldtrump in the White House. https://t.co/tF143JFxKF @bnn
. @AmbMacNaughton on diverging energy policy with US (pricing carbon); we have to remain competitive, it's not all about energy costs. @BNN
. @AmbMacNaughton on Mexico; says Canada wants NAFTA to work, but focus is first and foremost on what's good for Canada.@BNN
. @AmbMacNaughton says a protectionist US can take actions not aimed at us, but could have unintended consequences for both counties. @BNN
. @AmbMacNaughton says Canada's corporate tax rate is competitive and can remain so even if US cuts its tax rates. @BNN
. @AmbMacNaughton on softwood dispute: we are looking at support package for industry if we get into prolonged dispute. @BNN
. @AmbMacNaughton says Canada has engaged with Trump administration frequently, and "for the most part" positively." @BNN
@levinepmc @BNN True, but they are pretty to look at.
Dow and TSX both shed 100 points at the open; Dow breaks below 20,000. @BNN

@susurrou very hard to get an audience with the man these days... it really comes down to him liking the cut of your jib.

Poloz asked if Canadian business will get sideswiped by Trump protectionism... "We simply don't know." @BNN
BOC's Poloz: Loonie holding its own against USD means Canada losing competitiveness in US market. @BNN
BOC's Poloz says new economic models account for missing $30B to $40B in exports; too much focus on US developments before. @BNN
BOC's Poloz: Yes, a rate cut remains on the table. @BNN
BOC: US fiscal stimulus to have small effect in Canada, offset by 3 things including loss of competitiveness if US cuts corporate taxes.@BNN
BOC entered meeting "particularly concerned about the ramifications of US trade policy" adding "they are simply unknown at this point. @BNN
@ThatEricAlper @ThatEricAlper Great bass player... but a picture of The Smiths with @Johnny_Marr cropped out... sacrilege :)
@APeninsulaMan @BNN Hhhm. Can't see why it would impact me emotionally. The only skin I have in the game is a house in Brampton, ON.
Friday night. https://t.co/hNRdc4ZfBw
@hainsworthtv @theCHIVE Are they running Hainsworth photo galleries again?
@RitaTrichur My place in our old hood cost me $210K in 2002 -- 3 bedroom condo, 934 sq/ft. Good luck to the kids starting out now.
@RitaTrichur Mortgage Free! You mean if I had stayed in our old hood I could have been too?
@BenRabidoux ... modest incomes plus lure of cheap money got too many people into trouble?
@BenRabidoux My family moved to Brampton in '77. Always very much a blue collar town (as was my family)... 1/2
@BenRabidoux Hometown proud!
@alandrummond1 You boys having a wild night I gather?
BOC says few Canadian firms making concrete moves based on Trump winning White House, as uncertainty remains on impact of Trump policy. @BNN
BOC: Some Cdn businesses optimistic about Trump's infrastructure & military spending plans, while others concerned about protectionism. @BNN

When your gym is flooded with New Year's resolution 'posers' remember to be kind... they subsidize your workout the other 11.5 months!
Oil and gas extraction fell 2.5% in October, following four consecutive monthly increases. @BNN
Manufacturing output contracted 2.0% in October, the largest monthly decline since December 2013. @BNN
...Widespread decreases in manufacturing output and lower oil and gas extraction were the major contributors to the GDP decline. 2/2 @BNN
StatsCan: After increasing for four consecutive months, real gross domestic product was down 0.3% in October. 1/2 @BNN
@mikalfaro @GOtransit a flashback to "Billy keeps feeding lead pencils to the hamsters so you're all not having gym today" school years.
@mikalfaro @GOtransit haha. No, it we one of those train-wide announcements in which we were all scolded because someone held the doors open
I'm 45 years old, don't need to be lectured about another passagers' bad behaviour (holding the doors) on @GOtransit like we're in Grade 1.
@mlkibler @timhudak We'll definitely have him back in the New Year. He currently holds the title of the only @bnnhousemoney repeat guest.
@BNN in which Jeff poses the question... Can Donald Trump inspire millennials to procreate?

@hulkcharts The other caveat, it's 50% of new 'insured' mortgages in Q3. Uninsured mortgages originated in q3 not part of that calculation.

... I paused for a second, worried that it wasn't real and we were being punk'd. Didn't see interest free loans coming. 2/2
As a reporter (and not a columnist) I won't offer an opinion on BC's loans for 1st timers, but when I saw the release... 1/2
B.C's release on loans to first-time buyers: https://t.co/Et2LwD0LhH #VanRE @BNN
@greg_bonnell "After five years, buyers can either repay their loan or enter into monthly payments at current interest rates."
@mortimer_1 I thought they were going to tinker with Land Transfer Tax rebate. Didn't see interest-free govt loans coming, that's for sure.
